newsitem.title: USA: Siemens unit signs Internet pacts.
newsitem.headline: Siemens unit signs Internet pacts.

text.p: Siemens Stromberg-Carlson, a subsidiary of Siemens AG, said Monday it had signed contracts with Internet service providers (ISPs) in Argentina, Egypt and Turkey.

Depending on the specific requirements for each contract, Siemens said it will supply ISP hardware and software, systems integration services, software tools, applications development and customer support services.
Siemens did not provide financial details.

In Argentina, Siemens has sold five ISP networks to independent carriers located outside the greater Buenos Aires area. The solutions include a bundle of applications that will allow users to obtain and manage content locally.
In Egypt, Siemens completed an agreement with GEGA NET, an Egyptian-German telecommunications company, that will allow it to offer ISP service in Cairo and The Sixth Of October.
In Turkey, the contract was completed with Sim.Net, an Istanbul-based ISP that has a key application of travel and tourism.
